page.title: 08Lavethan Mill
page.content: Mr. Keat owns Lavethan Mill. The wheel was put there in 1921 which makes it 64 years old. In 1921 the wheel cost about Â£300. The diameter of the wheel is about 5 metres. The wheel has 8 spokes which are made out of cast iron. The 48 buckets are made out of Elm.The wheel is a swept back over shot.The business has been in the family for about 200 years. Mr. Keat said "We used to be over_run by mice". In the barn there are lots of birds. Upstairs was full of dust. Down stairs is full of grain. The miller sells food for ponies, dogs, cats, pigs, chickens, cows & calves. The miller employs several workmen and delivery drivers.
